title: PHPreturnKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPreturnKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return a value from a function:
<?php
function add1($x) {
return $x + 1;
}
echo "5 + 1 is " . add1(5);
?>

Definition and Usage
The
return
keyword ends a function and, optionally, uses the result of an expression as
the return value of the function.
If
return
is used outside of a function, it stops PHP code in the file from running. If the file
was included using
include
,
include_once
,
require
or
require_once
, the result of
the expression is used as the return value of the include statements.
Related Pages
Learn more functions in our
PHP Functions Tutorial
.

★
+1

quiz.question:
What is If
return?
quiz.explanation:

return is 'used outside of a function'.
